1.verse: Salutation -Chapter 1 -Address. -Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to further the faith of those whom God has chosen and their knowledge of religious truth,

2.verse: with its hope of eternal life that God, who does not lie, promised before the beginning of time,

3.verse: and who now at his appointed time has revealed his word through the proclamation with which I was entrusted by the command of God our Savior,

4.verse: to Titus, my loyal child in the faith we share: grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.

5.verse: Church Organization -A Bishop Must Be Blameless. -The reason I left you behind in Crete was so that you could finish up the work that remained to be done and appoint presbyters in every town as I directed you.

6.verse: Each man must be blameless and the husband of only one wife, with children who are believers and free from any suspicion of licentious or rebellious behavior.

7.verse: For in his role as God’s steward a bishop must be blameless. He must not be arrogant or quick-tempered or prone to drunkenness or violent or avaricious.

8.verse: Rather, he must be hospitable, a lover of goodness, prudent, upright, devout, and self-controlled.

9.verse: In addition, he must hold firmly to the authentic message he has been taught, so that he may be able both to exhort with sound doctrine and to refute those who contradict it.

10.verse: For the Pure All Things Are Pure. -For there are also many rebellious people, especially among the Jewish converts, who deceive others with their empty talk.

11.verse: It is essential to silence them, since they are ruining whole households by teaching for dishonest gain what it is not right to teach.

12.verse: It was one of their very own prophets, a man from Crete, who said,“Cretans have always been liars, vicious beasts, and lazy gluttons.”

13.verse: This testimony is true. Therefore, rebuke them sharply so that they may be restored to a sound faith,

14.verse: rather than paying attention to Jewish myths or to the commandments of those who turn away from the truth.

15.verse: To the pure all things are pure, but to those who are corrupt and without faith nothing is pure. Their very minds and their consciences have been corrupted.

16.verse: They profess to know God, but they deny him by their deeds. They are detestable and disobedient, totally unfit for any good work.

1.verse: Proper Conduct for Christians -Chapter 2 -Teach What Is Consistent with Sound Doctrine. -As for you, teach what is consistent with sound doctrine.

2.verse: Exhort the older men to be temperate, dignified, self-controlled, and sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance.

3.verse: Similarly, exhort the older women to be reverent in their behavior, not to be slanderous or slaves of drink, and eager to teach what is good.

4.verse: They can then instruct the younger women to love their husbands and their children,

5.verse: to be self-controlled and chaste, to be diligent homemakers, to be agreeable, and to respect the authority of their husbands so that the word of God may not be derided.

6.verse: Likewise, exhort the younger men to exercise self-control.

7.verse: Show yourself to them in all respects as a model of good works, while in your teaching exhibit integrity and dignity

8.verse: and a soundness of speech that cannot be criticized. Then any opponent will be put to shame when he can find nothing evil to say about us.

9.verse: Exhort slaves to be submissive to their masters and to give them satisfaction in every respect. They are not to talk back to them,

10.verse: nor are they to steal from them. Rather, they should show themselves to be completely trustworthy so that in every way they may add luster to the doctrine of God our Savior.

11.verse: The Grace of God Has Appeared. -For the grace of God has appeared bringing salvation to the entire human race.

12.verse: It teaches us to reject godless ways and worldly desires, and in the present age to lead lives that are temperate, just, and godly,

13.verse: while we await our blessed hope, the appearance of the glory of our great God and Savior Jesus Christ.

14.verse: He gave himself for us in order to deliver us from all iniquity and to purify for himself a people as his own who are eager to do good.

15.verse: The Goodness of God Our Savior. -These are the things you should expound. Exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no one disregard you.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Remind everyone to be subject to rulers and authorities, to obey them, to be ready to perform any honorable task,

2.verse: to slander no one, to avoid quarrels, to be gentle, and to be gracious to everyone.

3.verse: For we ourselves were once foolish, disobedient, led astray, and enslaved by various passions and pleasures, passing our days in malice and envy. We ourselves were hateful, and we hated one another.

4.verse: But when the goodness and loving kindnessof God our Savior appeared,

5.verse: not because of any righteous deeds on our partbut because of his mercy,he saved us through the bath of rebirthand renewal by the Holy Spirit,

6.verse: whom he lavished on us abundantlythrough Jesus Christ our Savior,

7.verse: so that we might be justified by his graceand become heirs in hope of eternal life.

8.verse: This saying can be trusted.Be Devoted to Good Works. - I want you to stress these points, so that those who have come to believe in God will be determined to devote themselves to good works. All this is right and beneficial for people.

9.verse: But avoid foolish arguments, genealogies, dissensions, and quarrels about the Law, for they are unprofitable and futile.

10.verse: Warn a heretic once or twice, but afterward reject him.

11.verse: You may be sure that such a person is perverted and sinful and stands self-condemned.

12.verse: Conclusion -Final Message. -As soon as I have sent Artemas or Tychicus to you, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, where I intend to spend the winter.

13.verse: Send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way, and see to it that they lack nothing.

14.verse: Meanwhile, our people must be taught to devote themselves to good works in order to meet urgent needs so that they will not be unfruitful.

15.verse: Farewell. -All those with me send you greetings. Greetings to those who love us in the faith.Grace be with all of you.
